dialogue.text: {i}Hours later — when the well has run dry...{/i}
Thanks for the ride, Nee-san. The limo might have been overkill, though. I would have been happy with a 99 Chevy Prizm.
What a specific car to have used as an example there. But also, you’re welcome. Even though you should probably be thanking our vegetable of a childhood friend instead of me.
If it wasn’t for him, I’d be either up on stage or...up on top of his penis right now.
Is...that really something you should be openly admitting to your little sister?
Yes. Who {i}else{/i} am I going to brag to? I don’t have any friends. The closest thing I have is that Kaori girl and that’s really just because of all the wieners.
Also, we don’t know for sure that Akira is a vegetable. Like, we haven’t even seen him since he got “sick.” Which is obviously just a front perpetuated by the world’s clingiest niece.
Yeah. That’s really starting to piss me off. Fool me once by keeping my boyfriend locked in his room for a whole month, shame on me. Fool me twice by keeping my boyfriend locked-
Yeah, I...I get it, Nee-san. He’s been in there for a while. But...at least we know where he is this time, right?
Yeah...but something’s really fishy about this whole thing. It’s textbook Akira to disappear when things get too hard, but why does {i}Ami{/i} seem so...fine?
Like, what could have gotten to {i}him{/i} so badly but not her?
I say we kill her and start taking care of him ourselves. I’m rich. Kind of. I could get away with it.
That...is definitely one way to handle this. Sure. But I’m kind of reluctant to do anything that drastic right now since it could always just make Akira even {i}worse.{/i}
So...it’s not the murder you have a problem with. It’s the fact that engaging in murder could make Akira like you less.
I said what I said.
Well, you’re definitely a Nakayama alright.
Was the bright pink hair not a big enough giveaway?
Do you think he’ll actually get to open our presents? Or do you think Ami threw them right into the trash the moment we left?

It’s hard to ever know with her. Like, some days, she seems like such an amazing, caring girl. Then others, it’s like she’s got so many screws loose that she’s the physical manifestation of a Home Depot dustbin.
Well, yeah. Why do you think I’m so nice to her all the time?
Because...you want Akira to like you as much as possible and it would be hard to win him over while trashing the only surviving member of his family?
That’s definitely a part of it, sure.
And there’s also a part of {i}me{/i} who remembers when she was a little kid. And yes, some kids grow up to be brats and just {i}remembering{/i} them shouldn’t give them a pass.
But {i}not{/i} everyone’s parents die in a car crash.
And {i}not{/i} everyone has to grow up in a household without a real guardian, taking care of a broken man who managed to break even {i}more{/i} after that same accident.
Ami’s been through a lot. Now, does that excuse her from being a control freak who won’t accept outside help from two people who have known him just as long as she has? Of course not.
But we need to remember that she’s just as fragile as him. And that she {i}is{/i} the physical manifestation of a Home Depot dustbin.
That speech almost made me forget that you suggested we kill her a few minutes ago.
I, too, am an enigma. And one that has accepted that sometimes, shit is just going to get really weird and there is basically nothing I can do about it.
How much longer are you willing to wait, though? Because at this rate, I’m starting to worry he might {i}never{/i} leave that house again without some...interference.
You know what would {i}really{/i} suck? If he wasn’t even there and Ami was just stalling us while he {i}flees{/i} again.
Nee-san. I will fucking {i}kill{/i} you if you joke about that again.
Oh, so {i}now{/i} murder is okay when the target is your own flesh and blood? Real cool, Noriko.
How could you even say that with a straight face?
Easy. Now that he knows how great it is to have sex with me, he’d obviously never run away again. And if he did, he’d come right back the second he gets a boner.
Don’t tell Mom I said that.
I am going to go inside and deliver this present now. Please never speak to me again.
Wait...Noriko.
You dare stop me when-
Who was that girl yesterday?
Girl? What girl?
The one who stormed out and slammed the door when we walked into Akira’s house.
Oh. Maya. Yeah, we’re kind of rivals...or something.
I don’t really know. Sensei used to tutor her as well and she kind of just hates me now because I still like him.
So...she likes Akira as well?
Who {i}doesn’t{/i} in this city? I feel like he’s even more popular than {i}you{/i} are and you’re on billboards.
I see...
Why do you ask, though? She was gone so quickly that I didn’t even realize you noticed her.
I don’t really know...
Something just felt kind of...{i}off{/i} about her. Like I recognize her from somewhere or...
I can’t really remember...
Well, you’re definitely right about something being {i}off.{/i}
I’ve been thinking the same thing lately. Just...in a way that probably wouldn’t make any sense to someone who just saw her for the first time.
Uhh...what? What does that mean?
She’s been, like...{i}different{/i} lately.
And so she told her-
Of the drastic difference between what once was and what now is — laced by a tinge of desperation and the desire not to understand, but to know.
She told her of the girl with eyes a step removed from aquamarine — who loved melons and hated {i}her.{/i} How she nearly lunged for her throat the moment they were reacquainted.
How she did it again just last month.
And how no one batted an eye.
No one thought it was {i}strange{/i} or {i}uncharacteristic.{/i} And these were all people that the girl in question appeared to ally herself with.
Noriko Nakayama believed, in her heart of purest hearts, that she was fit to be an ally — yet the stars and their subjects had ideas far detached from such a thing.
Why was it that {i}she,{/i} the one with olive branches for arms and exit signs for eyes, had to be the one tossed into the bonfire while her peers warmed their hands in blissful ignorance?
Each step deeper into the throat of a hotel where she would one day be betrayed caused a shooting pain to radiate from her left leg up to her neck and then right back down to its origin point.
She avoided the cracks in the tiled floor, but would deny to herself that it was superstition compelling her to act in such a manner.
Upon accidentally breaking her own traditions and worrying for a brief moment that she’d burst into flames due to failure, a thought crosses her eyelids before injecting itself into her nucleus.
Am I going insane?
Am I the only one who sees what’s happened?
When did the sun fall asleep? And when did twenty become nineteen?
The tiled floor’s response was not in words, but in soft clops as tradition reformed and reminded her that she would not burn to death today.
She enters a room that lacks color.
She looks around.
No more gaps in the tiles. No numbers on doors or discarded room service trays spilling their guts out into the stomach of the hallway.

Which of these greyscale creatures would tie a rope around her neck and pull her in before her incessant drive to destroy herself would cause her to act out and just {i}ask{/i} what she wanted to ask?
The color returns.
More steps are removed from aquamarine.
Hell nah. We really just gonna ignore how Rin’s plagiarizing my whole ass fit? Cause I don’t remember signing off on this. And I sign a lot of shit, yo.
I’m not plagiarizing anything! My outfit’s like...way different! Just...look! The belt...you know...I changed  how it’s positioned! And mine has...more holes in it!
They {i}do{/i} say that imitation is the best form of flattery...
The fuck are {i}“they?”{/i} Cause they ain’t been talkin’ to me! And if they ain’t talkin’ to me, chances are they’ve been helping Rin raid my damn closet.
Ah! Noriko!
Hey, Molly. Hey, Tsuneyo. Merry Christmas.
The magnets inside of them begin to pulsate and bubble up.
And a merry Christmas to you as well! But that’s enough celebrating. It’s time to get down to {i}business.{/i}
And you better hurry up because markets close at 4:00 PM EST and trading can become particularly volatile after-hours.
Also, Christmas to you as well.
Tell me, psion — how does thee feel about elves and the like?
Thee feels. But thee feelsest the feels that thou feelest not.
That-
What?
Word.
I think elves and the like are really cool. I’m just not really sure if I like them as much as you and the rest of the D&D squad if you were about to invite me to play with you guys.
Huh? How did you know? Did the Kendo Princess tell you?
No. I overheard you when you drew my name for Secret Santa and then loudly proclaimed that you knew a way to give me a present without having to spend any money.

Then, my masterful deduction skills led me to the conclusion that you were going to do this and that I was going to tell you that it’s cool if you just don’t give me a present. I know your game is full already.
Besides, I’m already in the process of writing a Pathfinder campaign with my sister and I’d prefer to focus on that over joining another campaign.
Wha- since when are you cool?! I didn’t know about that!
It’s not really anything to write home about. We’ve been working on it for years and are still nowhere close to done, so it’ll probably never see the light of day.
Have you considered making the paths easier to locate?
No, I’ll have to bring that up at our next sister meeting.
Please let that amazing business tip be my gift to you this holiday season in lieu of the Emerald Guardian’s forgotten one.
I...didn’t forget! I’ve just been pooling all of my money for my annual tradition of...buying myself a ton of games for Christmas and then barely talking to anyone for the next month.
That is what I’d like to call a “Molly Jolly Christmas.” Bam. Zoom. Joke complete.
Please ignore her. She’s trying to return to the world of stand-up comedy and is having trouble coming up with a catchphrase.
Molly, it’s cool. I already said I don’t need a present or anything like that. Just...treat me at Koi Cafe the next time I come in or something.
If you insist...but do know that I am monitored very closely at work as I have been labeled a “liability” in the past.
Liability? More like {i}cry-{/i}ability, you little bitch. Bam. Zoom. Joke complete.
As you can see, time away from the stand has made the Kendo Princess very rusty.
Ah! If it isn’t the girl who ditched me to hang out with her sister.
That loses a lot of impact when you say it while literally walking into the room with {i}your{/i} sister. At least I had the decency to leave mine in the car.
Hi Noriko! Merry Christmas! Kirin isn’t actually mad that you didn’t come shopping with us. We had a lot of fun.
Yeah. It {i}was{/i} just going to be us two, but we wound up bumping into Touka and Yasu as well and they tagged along with us for most of the trip.
Unfortunately, Touka had something come up and she won’t be able to make it to the party tonight.
That sucks. What about Yasu, though? Where’s she?
That’s a good question. Weren’t you watching her?
Me? I thought you said {i}you{/i} were going to watch her. She holds eye contact for too long and it makes me nervous.
She’s around. But enough about that — what’d you get me for Christmas this year?
I thought we weren’t exchanging gifts this year? I didn’t get you anything. And if you got {i}me{/i} something after telling me to not get you anything, I’m going to be very mad at you.
Aww, Noriko. Just knowing I was able to piss you off is better than any present you could possibly-
Kirin...look...
Huh? Look at what?
Mistletoe...
Ah! Look, everybody! Somebody finally fell for the trap! And by “somebody” I mean Kirin and Noriko!
Well...it looks like we’ll just have to-
Oh no! I am suddenly not under the mistletoe anymore!
Wait! Noriko! I came up with a good idea for my Christmas present!
